intro: Phymatopsis falcatopinnata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phymatopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, pinnately compound leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
